metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10221 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: A Reflected Cross Site Scripting vulnerability was found in all pki-core 10.x.x versions, where the pki-ca module from the pki-core server. This flaw is caused by missing sanitization of the GET URL parameters. An attacker could abuse this flaw to trick an authenticated user into clicking a specially crafted link which can execute arbitrary code when viewed in a browser.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
